name: SetupGitForWindowsSDK
description: Set up an environment to develop Git for Windows.
helpMarkDown: Sets up the Git for Windows SDK similar to the GitHub Action git-for-windows/setup-git-for-windows-sdk.
author: git-for-windows

inputs.name: flavor
inputs.label: SDK flavor
inputs.helpMarkDown: The subset (if any) of the SDK.

inputs.name: architecture
inputs.label: Architecture
inputs.helpMarkDown: The architecture of the SDK. Note that AMD64 (aarch64) only supports the 'full' flavor for now.

inputs.name: msys
inputs.label: MSYS mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to start in MSYS mode (defaults to false).

inputs.name: path
inputs.label: Install path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Where to write the SDK files.

inputs.name: cleanup
inputs.label: Cleanup
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to delete the SDK files.  This is only needed on self-hosted runners that are reused for multiple jobs.

inputs.name: verbose
inputs.label: Verbose
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether to log files as they are extracted.

inputs.name: githubToken
inputs.label: GitHub token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Personal access token (PAT) used to call into GitHub's REST API. We recommend using a service account with the least permissions necessary. Also when generating a new PAT, select the least scopes necessary. [Learn more about creating and using encrypted secrets](https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/creating-and-using-encrypted-secrets).

outputVariables.name: result
outputVariables.description: Path where the SDK was installed
